CatDescriptText: Jesse Jones, 1609 McCullough Street and Mrs. George King, 513 Armandale Street, North Side, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 5, 1957, pg. 2 with question: "Should ministers take an active part in politics? Do you believe that they should hold public office?" Jesse Jones' answer reads: "I don't think that ministers should be active in politics because politics is too crooked.  A minister has enough to do if he preaches the truth on Sunday and then practices what he preaches during the week."  Mrs. George King's answer reads: "Yes, I think that they should be active in politics because they could have a great influence in getting people to vote for the right person.  I don't think that ministers should hold public office, however.  There are a lot of dishonest politicians, and I don't think that they should be mixed up with them."
TitMainTitle: Jesse Jones wearing light colored jacket, tweed trousers with suspenders, patterned tie, tie bar, and fedora, and Mrs. George King wearing sleeveless plaid blouse, posed in front of light colored clapboard building, street no. 513
